title: Best Chocolate Chip Cookies (Community Enhanced)
ingredients: 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1 teaspoon almond extract
instructions: Gather your ingredients, making sure your butter is softened, and your eggs are room temperature.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Beat butter, white sugar, and brown sugar in a large bowl with an electric mixer until smooth and creamy.
Beat in eggs, one at a time, then stir in vanilla.
Dissolve baking soda in hot water; add to batter along with salt and mix until combined.
Stir in flour, chocolate chips, and walnuts until a soft dough forms.
Drop medium-sized rounded spoonfuls of cookie dough onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake in the preheated oven until edges are lightly browned, about 10 minutes.
Cool on the baking sheets briefly before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.
Store in an airtight container or serve immediately and enjoy!

source_review.text: I definitely will make this one again, although I made a couple adjustments....I guess my chocolate chips went "cupboardy" as I say, since I haven't baked in a while, so I had to toss them, and I didn't have walnuts on hand....however, I had chocolate covered almonds. Chopped them in half (the larger ones chopped in 3's). Also instead of 2 tsp vanilla extract I did 1 vanilla 1 almond. They turned out perfect and so delicious! I made medium sized cookies (not small, not huge) and got 26 out of this recipe. They were so good I think I will do chocolate covered almonds, and vanilla & almond extracts next time too.

modifications_applied.reasoning: Omitting walnuts due to lack of availability
